Knowledge related Questions for Students.question: Which of the following snacks is unhealthy to eat on a regular basis
Fruits and vegetables provide which one of the following nutrients.
Drinking sugar sweetened beverages (e.g Coke, Cola, sprint,SSB etc) can increase my body weight
Eating fruit and vegetables is better than eating lollies
Being bigger than average can be bad for your health
From the foods given below which of the foods provide energy to the body
From the foods given below which of the food is included in body building food group
From the foods given below which of the food is included in healthy foods, food group
Physical exercise(e.g. playing football, rugby, net ball, swimming etc) are important as they help to control weight
Which of these are unhealthy foods
Watching too much TV, playing mobile games, using computer for majority of your free time and not playing outdoors is bad for your health

Attitude related Questions for Students.question: How strongly do you agree or disagree with the following statements?

options.option: Eating vegetables makes me feel healthy
I like the taste of many vegetables like carrots, cabbage, beans, rourou etc.
I think there is enough vegetables are served at dinner most nights
I like tasting new vegetables that I haven’t tried before
Eating fruit makes me feel healthy
I like the taste of most fruit like pawpaw, pineapples and watermelon
I like tasting new fruits that I haven’t tried before
In my home fruit is available to eat at any time
I ask my parents to buy foods or drinks that I see advertised on television
My parents encourage me to eat fruit and vegetables
Most of my teachers encourage the students to eat fruit and vegetables
I think learning about food and health is important for me to know.
If the weather is good, I am encouraged by myparents to play outside
enjoy eating snack (bongo and chips) while watching TV every day.

Practice related Questions for Students.question: Think about yesterday. Describe what you drank at each time?
Practice related Questions for Students.instruction: Tick as many boxes as apply

options.option: Fruit Juice or fruit juice drink
Regular Soft Drink or Energy/Sports Drink (eg. Powerade, Frubu or Sunfresh)
Diet  Soft  Drink  (e.g.  Coke Zero, Diet Fanta)

Practice related Questions for Students.question: Think about yesterday. Describe what you eat at each time?
Practice related Questions for Students.instruction: Tick as many boxes as apply

options.option: Potato crisps or similar snack (e.g. twisties)

Practice related Questions for Students.question: How often do you usually do the following?
Practice related Questions for Students.instruction: Tick one box in each row

options.option: Drink fruit juice or fruit juice drink
Eat potato crisps or similarsnack (e.g. twisties)
Help choose or buy groceriesfor the family
Eat dinner with most of the family
Eat dinner in front of the television
Eat snacks in front of the television

Practice related Questions for Students.question: What do you usually do after school? (One or more possible responses)

options.option: play in the neighbourhood with my friends
I play video or computer games
I play sports in school team

Practice related Questions for Students.question: On how many of the past 7 days did you exercise or took part in physical activity (for example: rugby, Soccer, net ball,  dancing, swimming, or other similar activities)
How many hours did you watch TV or DVD movies at homeper day?
How many hours per school day you usually spend on the computer or laptop away from school? (Exclude the time spend on doing school home work or assignments).
How many hours per day on weekends you usually spend on the computer or laptop away from school? (Exclude the time spend on doing school home work or assignments).
How many hours per day you usually spend playing video games on mobile phones, tablets etc
In the last 5 school days, how many times did you watch TV while eating your dinner?

Demographic Questions for Parents.question: What is your household average income per month?
How many children do you have?
What is your highest level of education? Please tick appropriate box.
What is your occupation status? Please tick appropriate box.

Knowledge Related Questions for Parents.question: Children can be obese.
Eating fatty foods cause obesity.
An obese child will become an obese adult
Parents should prevent their children from obesity.
Eating more vegetables and fruits is the best methods to reduce weight.
According to you, which is a healthy diet?

options.option: A diet contains variety of healthy foods
A diet whose foods are rich in protein (meat, fish, eggs, cheese, dried legumes)

Knowledge Related Questions for Parents.question: According to you, which is the healthiest food?

options.option: A food very rich in dressing

Knowledge Related Questions for Parents.question: According to you, which is the healthiest cooking method?

options.option: Cooking in the oven with fats
Cooking in a pan with fats

Knowledge Related Questions for Parents.question: Which food contains carbohydrates?
According to you, what is a “balanced diet”?

options.option: A diet containing all nutrients in proper quantities

Knowledge Related Questions for Parents.question: According to you, what is “daily energy expenditure”?

options.option: Energy consumed in the whole day
Energy consumed only for physical activity
Energy consumed for maintaining body temperature at 37°C

Knowledge Related Questions for Parents.question: What are “biological foods”?

options.option: Foods grown without any use of chemical fertilizer
Foods grown in a ground far from the highway

Knowledge Related Questions for Parents.question: According to you, which is the healthiest eating behaviors?

options.option: Drinking 2 glasses of milk/eating 2 cups of yogurt every day
Preferring cooked vegetables to uncooked vegetables
Eating always cheese instead of meat
When you eat snacks, preferring fruit/fruit juice/ biscuits and crackers

Knowledge Related Questions for Parents.question: Physical exercise is the best methods to reduce weight.
Physical activity can decrease obesity and changes of developing Type II diabetes.
High blood pressure can be reduced by physical activity
Performing physical exercise only on weekend is enough to achieve health benefits.
What is the minimum number of days per week you believe a person must be physically active in order to receive any health benefit?
What is the minimum length of time (in minutes) one needs to be physically active throughout a typical day in order to achieve a health benefit?
Which is an example of aerobic exercise?

Attitude Related Questions for Parents.question: My kid feels comfortable discussing physical activities with me
My kid really likes to learn a new sport.
I believe that doing physical activity frequently is good for my child
My child gives physical activity high priority among other activities
I am interested that my child will be doing exercise in future
Physical activity improves my child physical health
Physical activity provides good opportunities to my child for developing social contacts
Physical activity helps my child to have more control over his/her eating behaviors
think physical activity needs to be included school curriculum
Obesity is an indicator of good health
Fast food should be limited to once a week for my child
My child needs to access to more fruits, vegetables and other healthy foods
What my child eats can make difference in him/her chances of getting heart disease or cancer
Learning about the relationship between food and health is important for my child to know
Learning about the relationship between physical activity and health is important for my child to know
My child is willing to try new foods
My childneeds to stop eatingthose food which are not good for him/her

Practice Related Questions for Parents.question: I talk to children about healthy foods.
Does your child always eat home-cooked meals?
Does your child consume fruits every day?
Do you use vegetables in your child food?
Do you give your child snack between meals?
Do you educate you child about the foods quality?
How many total cups of fruits your child consumes each day?
Do you usually give your child a cake or desert at meals/snake?
Which beverages does your child usually drink between meals?

options.option: Soft drinks (cola, sprite, frubu, pepsi, etc.)

Practice Related Questions for Parents.question: Do you play games like football, rugby, walking, swimming etcwith you child every day?
In an average week, my child exercise 3–4 times such as running, taking along walks, dancing, playing ball, swimming, and rugby.
My child participate in a regular program of sports/exercises
What your child should do during his/her free time?

options.option: Watching TV/listening to music /using the computer/ reading a book

Practice Related Questions for Parents.question: How many hours does yourchild spend on the computer or watching TV?
How many hours does yourchild spend on watching TV?
During the past 12 months, on how many sports teams did your child play? (Include any teams run by your child’s school or community groups.)
